metadata.title: CVE-2016-2180 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The TS_OBJ_print_bio function in crypto/ts/ts_lib.c in the X.509 Public KeyInfrastructure Time-Stamp Protocol (TSP) implementation in OpenSSL through1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-boundsread and application crash) via a crafted time-stamp file that ismishandled by the "openssl ts" command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2180` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
